result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

*Bond money on file can be applied to 16CF37 and 15CM326

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher A. Adams in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF37 & 15CM326.

11:15 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF37:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - DRI

15CM326:
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has consulted with the victim and has complied with the victim's rights notification; victim does not appear in court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 of 16CF37 and Count 1 of 15CM326 and Count 1 & 2 of 16CF37 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CF37:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA sample
Bond money on file can be applied to the costs/fine's on both cases

Count 3 - DRI

15CM326:
Count 1 - 
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Christopher A. Adams in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A. Adams in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG on Misd counts
Prelim scheduled for count
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Comply with bond conditions in 15CM326 which includes no direct or indirect contact with Ms. Leary or anyone at her residence.

DA #16PT44
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump & Violate Restraining Order 14CV363.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements and requests lower cash bond or signature bond.
BTC: $1,000 cash bond with stated conditions.
Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 1-25-16   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
